content.text: Variables in Bash are used to store data that can be used and manipulated throughout your script or command-line session. Bash variables are untyped, meaning they can hold any type of data.
content.html: Variables in Bash are used to store data that can be used and manipulated throughout your script or command-line session. Bash variables are untyped, meaning they can hold any type of data.

content.text: Variables are declared by simply assigning a value to a name. There should be no spaces around the equal sign:
content.html: Variables are declared by simply assigning a value to a name. There should be no spaces around the equal sign:

content.code:
name
=
"John Doe"


echo

"Hello,
$name
!"


number
=
42


echo

"The number is
$number
"
content.code_html:
name="John Doe"
echo "Hello, $name!"
number=42
echo "The number is $number"

content.text: Environment variables are special variables that affect the way processes run on your system. They are often used to store system-wide values like the location of executables or the default editor.
content.html: Environment variables are special variables that affect the way processes run on your system. They are often used to store system-wide values like the location of executables or the default editor.

content.code:
# Display the PATH environment variable


echo

"Your PATH is
$PATH
"
content.code_html:
# Display the PATH environment variable
echo "Your PATH is $PATH"

content.text: Local variables are only available within the block of code in which they are defined, such as within a function. Global variables are accessible from anywhere in the script.
content.html: Local variables are only available within the block of code in which they are defined, such as within a function. Global variables are accessible from anywhere in the script.

content.code:
# Define a local variable in a function


my_function
(
)

{


local

local_var
=
"I am local"


echo

$local_var


}

my_function
content.code_html:
# Define a local variable in a function
my_function() {
  local local_var="I am local"
  echo $local_var
}
my_function

content.text: Variables can be used in various operations, such as concatenation and arithmetic.
content.html: Variables can be used in various operations, such as concatenation and arithmetic.

content.code:

greeting
=
"Hello, "


name
=
"World"


echo

"
$greeting
$name
"



# Arithmetic


num1
=
5


num2
=
10


sum
=
$((
num1
+
num2
))


echo

"The sum is
$sum
"
content.code_html:
# Concatenation
greeting="Hello, "
name="World"
echo "$greeting$name"

# Arithmetic
num1=5
num2=10
sum=$((num1 + num2))
echo "The sum is $sum"
